entry.title: The Integrated Toolchain in a Nutshell
entry.content:
Part three of the five-part series, ‚ÄúRISE with SAP Methodology‚Äù

If cloud ERP programs were judged purely by technology choices, most would look successful on paper. Platforms are modern. Architectures are sound. Road maps are ambitious.

Yet for many organizations, the lived experience tells a different story. Ask any experienced SAP solution admin or transformation lead where time and energy are really lost, and the answer is almost always execution. Teams fight more with coordination than configuration. Customers often describe it painfully clearly: ‚ÄúWe spend more time aligning than delivering.‚Äù Fragmentation creeps in where continuity should exist across collaboration, handoffs, rework, and alignment cycles.

This is exactly the challenge RISE with SAP Methodology is designed to address. With the integrated toolchain at its core, the methodology establishes a connected execution backbone that keeps process, architecture, testing, quality, and adoption moving forward together (as shown in the figure).


Figure: The integrated toolchain within RISE with SAP Methodology


How a single transformation backbone is created

The integrated toolchain helps transform ERP landscapes toward SAP Business Suite by orchestrating change holistically across people, processes, applications, and data.

It consists of a variety of solutions that work together to connect design, execution, governance, and long-term operation across the transformation lifecycle:

  • SAP Signavio solutions provide transparency into how business processes run and support fit-to-standard decisions and continuous improvement
  • SAP LeanIX solutions create clarity across the application and integration landscape, supporting a clean core approach and architectural governance
  • SAP Cloud ALM acts as the central system of record for execution, connecting scope, requirements, milestones, risks, testing, and cutover
  • SAP Build solutions enable controlled extensibility and innovation and keep the digital core standardized and upgrade-safe
  • SAP Integration Suite governs and automates integrations across SAP and third-party solutions
  • SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing solution by Tricentis introduces process-driven, automated testing
  • SAP Advanced Data Migration and Management software by Syniti supports early and structured data cleansing, validation, and transformation
  • SAP Archiving and Document Access application by OpenText helps reduce the data footprint and preserve compliance and access to historical documents
  • WalkMe solutions support adoption by guiding users directly in the solution as processes evolve

Collectively, this integrated toolchain enables continuous upgrades, delivers on clean core strategy expectations, accelerates business change, and maintains execution discipline.

A shared system of record is created, one where decisions are made once, documented once, and reused everywhere they matter across phases, teams, and roles. Processes, architecture, requirements, testing, data, integrations, and adoption progress as one connected flow, instead of parallel workstreams hoping to stay aligned.

 
A customer transformation example: Where continuity happens in practice

Suppose a global company is embarking on its move to SAP Cloud ERP Private through the RISE with SAP journey. The goal is not to replicate the past in a new environment, but to simplify processes, reduce customizations, and create a foundation that can evolve over time.

The transformation starts with understanding, not a configuration. While new SAP customers start directly in the discover and onboarding phase with the digital discovery assessment toolkit using the SAP Cloud ALM solution, installed-base customers start with understanding their current state.

Using SAP Signavio solutions, the company‚Äôs team gains factual insight into how business processes actually run across regions, highlighting variations, bottlenecks, and improvement potential. In parallel, SAP LeanIX solutions provide visibility into the existing architecture, application landscape, integrations, and dependencies, while the SAP Readiness Check toolset delivers technical insight into custom code and required simplifications.

With this clarity established, execution gains structure. SAP Cloud ALM becomes the central orchestration layer where scope, requirements, milestones, risks, and responsibilities are documented and connected.

Decisions made in workshops no longer disappear into slide decks‚Äîthey are traceable, actionable, and visible across teams. Data is addressed early using SAP Advanced Data Migration and Management, and SAP Archiving and Document Access helps define which historical data and documents need to remain accessible without burdening the future system.

As the program moves into fit-to-standard discussions, evidence replaces opinion. SAP Signavio solutions provide a clear reference for standard SAP processes, and SAP LeanIX solutions continuously assess the architectural impact of proposed deviations. Where extensions are justified, SAP Build enables application development in a manner that‚Äôs clean and upgrade-safe. Integrations are also defined and governed through SAP Integration Suite to help ensure transparency and resilience across the broader ecosystem.

During realization, quality becomes a continuous signal rather than a final checkpoint. SAP Cloud ALM maintains structure across delivery activities. SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis automates testing based on real business processes. Test results, defects, and fixes remain traceable back to original requirements, giving stakeholders a clear view of readiness and risk at all times.

As go-live approaches, cutover planning is no longer a fragile spreadsheet exercise based on assumptive narratives. SAP Cloud ALM brings together testing status, data readiness, integration stability, and archiving decisions into a single, evidence-based view. Leadership decisions about timing and risk are grounded in facts.

After go-live, the same execution backbone continues to support monitoring, stabilization, and continuous improvement. WalkMe solutions guide users directly in the system as processes evolve, while SAP Signavio and SAP LeanIX solutions keep process and architecture transparency intact as new changes are introduced.

As this story proves, the absence of fragmentation is what makes a difference when transitioning and upgrading the IT landscape. No decisions vanish into inboxes. No testing evidence lives on private drives. No critical knowledge depends on heroics. The transformation unfolds as one connected flow‚Äîfrom first insight through ongoing operations.


Why this approach works

In a cloud ERP world defined by continuous change, fragmentation is a structural risk. The integrated toolchain within RISE with SAP Methodology replaces that risk with continuity, transparency, and control.
ERP systems are inherently complex, but hidden complexity doesn‚Äôt have to accumulate unnoticed. With a connected system of execution, organizations gain one source of truth. Decisions retain their context and ownership. Testing reflects real-world business use. Clean core strategies make upgrades easier. Continuous improvement becomes possible without rework or documentation resets.

The result is not simply a successful go-live, but a transformation foundation that endures as the business evolves over the long term.

To learn more about RISE with SAP Methodology, read our in-depth overview.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What‚Äôs next?

 In the next part in our ‚ÄúRISE with SAP Methodology‚Äù series, we‚Äôll explore how guided expert support accelerates transformation with less risk and better decisions at each stage of the journey:

January 28: "Expert Guidance: Your Guided Transformation Accelerator"

Revisit our previous blogs and stay tuned for the rest of the blog series, too:

  • Part 1: RISE with SAP Methodology: A Practical Guide to Modernizing with Confidence
  • Part 2: Deep Dive: Inside the Framework of RISE with SAP Methodology and Its Connection to SAP Activate
  • Part 4: Expert Guidance: Your Guided Transformation Accelerator (coming January 28)
  • Part 5: The Combined Power of SAP Business AI and RISE with SAP Methodology (coming February 11)

 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

#clouderpprivate #s4hanacloud #sap #risewithsap #transformation #risewithsapmethodology

entry.title: Re: Push from the (customer) Account general menu a field...
entry.content:
Dear requester,

I suppose you are questioning about the ABC Classification field in the Account master data - General tab. This is the standard field.
In the sales order, when entering an account, the account ID/name and address information (as well as the contact) is then determined and filled in the sales order. But the other attributes like ABC Classification is not taken/shown. This is the current design. And there is no option to make the standard field to be shown in the sales order currently.

If it is critical for your sales order documents, you can create an Extension Field in the Account master data and maintain the same value. Then enable the extension scenario from account master to sales order. Afterwards, when you creating a new sales order and entering the account, the extension field will fetch the value from account master data and show it in the sales order.

Hope this answers your question.

Thanks,
Adie
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytical Reports G\L Accounts Goods Receipt/Man...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

You may want to try out the following procedure:

  1. Use the Custom CDS Views app to create a new CDS view that aggregates production quantities. This view should not include G/L account dimensions.
  2. Select a data source that contains production data (production orders, material movements...) and aggregate the data to get total production in kilos and total quantity.
  3. In the next step, use the Custom Analytical Queries app to create a new query that is based on the CDS view you created.
  4. In the query, the production quantities should be displayed as separate rows; set them as measures and don't associate them with any G/L account dimensions.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: PM order and assignment to WBS element - possibilities
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the two WBS element fields in a maintenance order serve different purposes: the ‚ÄúAccount Assignment WBS Element‚Äù drives actual cost postings and settlement, while the ‚ÄúPlanning WBS Element‚Äù is used for budgeting, simulation, and organizational reporting. Yes, multiple maintenance orders can be assigned to the same WBS element to track costs centrally, but the functionality is streamlined compared to On-Premise ECM/PM integration.

Answers to Your Specific Questions

What do you do with this assignment?
Use it to link maintenance orders to projects for cost tracking and planning. The Account Assignment WBS drives settlement, while the Planning WBS supports reporting.

Is it possible to assign multiple maintenance orders to a PSP element and track costs centrally?
Yes. All orders assigned to the same WBS element will post costs there, allowing centralized tracking.

Is there a documented process/scope item/test script?
Scope Item 4VT (Improvement Maintenance) is the main reference. It shows project creation and assignment. Beyond that, SAP documentation on Account Assignment in S/4HANA Cloud and WBS Element in Service provide examples of how costs and revenues flow into WBS elements.

entry.title: SAP Business One Service Layer ‚Äì Copy From Landed Cost to A/P Invoice (BaseType 69 Not Supported)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working on SAP Business One 10.0 using the Service Layer (v2) to automate broker invoice posting as part of an AI / Agentic Automation application.

Business Scenario (GUI)

In SAP GUI, users:

  • Open A/P Invoice

  • Click Copy From ‚Üí Landed Cost

  • Select the broker Landed Cost
    SAP automatically:

  • Creates the A/P Invoice

  • Builds the Relationship Map link between Landed Cost and the invoice

API Scenario (Service Layer)

Using Service Layer, I:

  • Retrieve the Landed Cost via /LandedCosts

  • Create the broker A/P Invoice via /PurchaseInvoices

When I attempt to link the invoice line using:

  • BaseType = 69 (Landed Cost)

  • BaseEntry = <LandedCost DocEntry>

SAP returns the error:
‚ÄúBaseType 69 is not valid‚Äù

From my research, Service Layer does not support ‚ÄúCopy From Landed Cost‚Äù, and no relationship is created in the Relationship Map when posting via API.

Questions

  1. Is there any supported way to create a Landed Cost ‚Üí A/P Invoice relationship using Service Layer?

  2. If Service Layer does not support this, what is the recommended enterprise approach?

    • DI API / SDK add-on?

    • Referenced Documents?

    • Any other SAP-supported pattern?

  3. How do customers usually automate this process while preserving the Relationship Map, especially in AI or RPA-driven solutions?

Any guidance or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,
Zain

 

@ANKIT_CHAUHAN 

@Chris1973 

@Lakshmipathi 

@dawid90

entry.title: Re: Happy New Year 2026! Got a minute? Tell us what you think!
entry.content:
I want not to be disrespectful, nor offend you, I understand you do your work the best possible, but I will not invest my work time (nor my free time) in a site I gave up years ago.

I keep coming because sometimes the search works, but just a little better than any of my IAs. I'm sick (not tired, sick) of the many times SAP (not you, the company you work for, I mean the people who decide about this site) has changed things here leaving a mess behind.

The main problem of this site is the massive amount of wrong information it holds, and its inhability to filter and/or delete it. The gamification (and I love gamifications), the badges and other "self-promotion" things it gaves make some people to force their way into those things, by been over-active posting repetitive content or, even worse in some cases, wrong one.

Then you have the mutability: it seems this site is unable to find its identity: not just aesthetic, but functional too. It evolves from classical forum to something that I cannot define, then goes backwards to the forums but losing part of its features, and all those steps while making announcements about aesthetics that some people (at leass I do) do not care or did not asked for.

Meanwhile, the useful features we've lost are still in the void (like the one who allowed me to follow people and been noticed about their new content), the structure becomes more and more difficult to navigate.

Where could I find the ABAP questions board if I would try to help people again? Dunno, and don't care, because I gave up, because the excessive "politeness" this place must keep (and I understand it, no complains).

The site is too intrusive: if I want specific alerts, most of the time I end with an excessive amount of them. Not sure if someone fixed it and now the messages can be massively deleted, but I gave up on them and decided to stop monitoring things.

The last time I tried to post a suggestion, I spent a lot of time redacting the post to be well-mannered and all those things, and when I've got happy enough, I pressed the publish button and then the site told me I could not post there. Not remember the board (one of the community ones). If I will not be able to post, why do the site provides me a "new" button in the first place?

Too much time wasted and too much frustrations for me to try to keep trying, sorry. I just come here for the fast food, the wrong answers hoping they have a hint towards the good direction and because ... not sure how to explain it, maybe you call it "remote tiny sceptic hope".

Again, I wish I did not offend you nor anyone whith hope and/or good intentions for this place. I spent much more time writing this because your kind consideration towards us, but I will not go further, sorry.

entry.title: Re: Project Cost Report does not display actual costs?
entry.content:
There is no customizing in Public Cloud for this ‚Äî it‚Äôs controlled by scope item activation and master data setup. If you see costs in line-item reports but not in F2513, it usually means:

  • The WBS is not linked to a proper project definition, or
  • The project/WBS is not in released status, or
  • The wrong WBS field (planning vs. account assignment) was used.

entry.title: What‚Äôs New in SAP Warehouse Logistics: Year-End 2025 Feature Highlights
entry.content:
2025 was a great year for SAP Warehouse Logistics, the mobile app for SAP Logistics Management. At the end of the year, we rolled out powerful new features designed to make SAP Logistics Management on mobile more intuitive. Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new compared to previous versions:

  • Work Queues: Leverage work queues to receive and organize workload efficiently.
  • Pick by Deliveries: Start picking by scanning the outbound delivery number for faster operations.
  • Exception Handling: Change quantity and destination during picking for maximum flexibility.

Let‚Äôs deep dive into these features:

Work Queues

You can now leverage work queues to receive and organize your workload efficiently.

What‚Äôs new: You can either work on your default work queue or temporarily switch to any other queue as needed.

On the Home Screen, you‚Äôll be prompted to select your default work queue. Alternatively, you can change it anytime in Profile & Settings -> Queue section.

Both options display a list of available work queues in the warehouse. You can search by text or scan the queue name to select the queue you want to work in.

Why it matters: This flexibility helps the logistics clerk to distribute tasks and the warehouse operative to prioritize tasks and adapt quickly to changing operational needs.

      

Once a default queue is selected, simply tap ‚ÄúNext Task‚Äù. You‚Äôll see an overview of the next picking task in the work queue and can start the task immediately. 

      

If you‚Äôre asked to work on another queue, no problem! Use the ‚ÄúQueues‚Äù entry point on the Home Screen. From there, you‚Äôll see a list of all queues in the warehouse. You can search or scan the queue name, then tap ‚ÄúStart Queue‚Äù to begin. You‚Äôll get an overview of the next picking task within this queue and can start right away.

       

Pick by Deliveries

Picking by deliveries is now possible in the new release.

What‚Äôs new:

  • On the Home Screen, you‚Äôll find a new entry point called ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù.
  • From this entry point, you can search or scan the delivery number.
  • Once selected, all open tasks related to this delivery will be displayed.
  • You can then choose one task and start picking immediately.

Why it matters: This feature streamlines the picking process for delivery-based workflows and is especially helpful for the so called ‚Äúsingle order picking‚Äù. It does reduce errors and consolidation efforts and with this ultimately improves efficiency.

      

Exception Handling

Handle unexpected situations during picking without interrupting your workflow.

What‚Äôs new:

  • During picking, if you find that an item is missing and you cannot pick the full required quantity, or if the destination bin is full and you cannot drop items there - no worries!
  • You can now adjust the quantity and/or change the destination bin directly during picking.
  • For example: If 5 bags are required for a specific warehouse task but you only find 4 bags, simply change the quantity to what you actually picked. Also, if the destination bin is full, you can confirm the drop-off at an alternative destination bin.
  • Changes during warehouse task execution are clearly marked with ‚ÄúCHANGED‚Äù labels, so you can easily identify modified quantity and destination.  

Why it matters: This feature gives you flexibility to handle exceptions during warehouse task execution quickly, ensuring smooth operations and accurate inventory updates.

     

Which feature do you love most? Or what would you like to see next? Share your thoughts!

Further Information

SAP Logistics Management Product Page

SAP Logistics Management What's New Viewer

entry.title: Manage Workforce App Limitations When Integrating Employees from SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Dear Expert.

We are reviewing the employee information interface between SAP SuccessFactors and SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
According to Note DIGITS, it is mentioned that if the following communication scenarios are active, the ‚ÄúManage Workforce‚Äù app cannot be used to create employees in certain cases :

  • SAP_COM_0001 (JB1)

  • SAP_COM_0301 (Replicate Basic Master Data for Workforce from External HR Systems)

  • SAP_COM_0575, SAP_COM_0594, SAP_COM_0659 (Master Data Integration)

We would like to verify the technical limitations of the Manage Workforce app when receiving employees from SuccessFactors.

  1. Is it possible to create users directly in Public Cloud independently of the users received via interface?

  2. If the employees received via interface do not have bank information, can this information be added or updated afterward?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Manage Workforce App Limitations When Integrating Emp...
entry.content:
For the First issue, Is it possible to create users directly in Public Cloud independently of the users received via interface?

Yes, it is possible to create an user directly in the S/4HANA System via the application "Manage Workforce". But if you are using any other channels like SOAP API, MDI or JB1 or any other channels it is advised as per SAP to use one channel to create and update the Worker with the same channel. In that case all the creation and updation will be done via that specific channel and not via any other channel or directly via the app.

Please refer to the below KBA for Replicating Workforce Persons Using New Integration Channels

##2813743 - What to Consider When Replicating Workforce Persons Using New Integration Channels in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

And secondly, If the employees received via interface do not have bank information, can this information be added or updated afterward?

If the Worker/Employee that you are trying to create does not have the Bank Information then also it is possible to create a Worker or such cases the information can be passed via the update payload of the Worker with the same channel with the new payload.

For an Example, if you are using the SuccessFactor option then refer the below help document to see the Bank Information is marked as optional and you can update the same Worker with the full payload with the Bank details later as per your business requirement.

What Is Payment Information? | SAP Help Portal 

 

Thanks and Regards,

SAP support.

entry.title: Re: What is the simplest, step‚Äëby‚Äëstep prepackaged approa...
entry.content:
1. Is there a single, clear document that explains the end‚Äëto‚Äëend setup (prerequisites, iFlows, connectivity, key mapping, and testing) for the prepackaged solution?
    [Answer]:  Here a documentation on how to acheive that: https://help.sap.com/docs/sisgw/sap-ariba-cloud-integration-gateway-overview-guide/integrating-sap-s-4hana-cloud-with-sap-ariba-solutions-using-sap-integration-suite?locale=en-US&version=LATEST 
  2. Can this integration be implemented without SAP Ariba Cloud Integration Gateway (CIG), or is CIG required? [Answer]: CIG is normally the integration way to go, even if you go with the Integrations Suite, you can used the iflow, but all the maintenance and update be challenging.  It is important to know that CIG is built on top of Integration Suite, so in another terms, it is a lightway version of Integration Suite and it doesn't require a separate licence.
  3. If CIG is required, do we need a separate license for CIG, and where is this licensing documented? [Answer]: No, if you have any SAP Ariba Product Licence, CIG is free of charge.
  4. Are there any differences in steps or components when integrating to S/4HANA Private Cloud vs. S/4HANA Public Cloud? [Answer]: Private Cloud require the CIG addons installation, this works exactly as on premise system. However the Public Cloud works on scope items that need to be activated and come with some communication arrangement setup. Bothe are quite different in terms of Integration.

entry.title: Re: Introduction to the Parallel Line
entry.content:
Hi everyone and thanks for the useful explanation: I have some questions.

Looking at the pre-requisites for the S4 Tenants branch.

  • Customizing tenant: Release all CBC and BC transports in the customizing tenant.
    • The copy seems to be a Local Client Copy (SID/100 to SID/120): acknowledging the best practice is to release (or in exceptional cases, discharge the modification) all transports before a copy/upgrade, this pre-requisite will be not always easy to satisfy by customers, as it implies a stop on the project activities and maintenance activities (change freeze): is there a way to lift this requirement? Technically, the copy could be performed. 
  • Test tenant: Import all transports in the import buffer of the test tenant.
    • Not all TR are supposed to be imported into TEST. Is that an effective hard-requirement and if so, why? Is there a way to lift this restriction? 

For what concerns the possible behavior of Project Line during Major Upgrades/HFC.

  • Being sitting on the same SID, Dev/080+100+120 and TST/100+120 will have same maintenance windows.
    • In case of regress test findings or pre/post activities required, what is the SAP recommendation/best practice to follow, to ensure the adjustment is deployed on both lines? Example on the IAM part and the correction activities to be performed in relation to Business Catalogs/Restrictions phased in-out: would be the export/import of the software collection from DEV/100 to DEV/120 be an option, or manual changes are expected to be applied to the each Customizing Tenant? 

Exclusions from Branch activities.

  • Master and Transactional data are intentionally excluded from the branching.
    • Can be the SAP TDR (Test Data Refresh) an option to copy content from the Productive system? 
    • Users are not copied during Branch. Will the pre-req of TDR (outnumbering workers ID) also be applicable in this scenario? 
    • Could be the PL (TST/120) together with the TDR seen as a possible combination of activities to create a Pre-Production System?

Working in a 5SL (5-System Landscape, Project and Maintenance Line).

  • After the initial branching (first deployment of Project Line), the synchronization activities are the Rebase/Merging, at CBC Level. What about the KUE/Customizing?

 

Regards, Cristian

entry.title: Re: Length Of Service /Age Story Reports
entry.content:
IF((DAYS_BETWEEN([Original Hire Date],CURRENTDATE())/365.25)>=10,

LEFT(TOTEXT(DAYS_BETWEEN([Original Hire Date],CURRENTDATE())/365.25),2),

LEFT(TOTEXT(DAYS_BETWEEN([Original Hire Date],CURRENTDATE())/365.25),1))

This should get you most of the way there. It calculates difference in days between today and [original hire date] (I've removed the whole data eval path for clarity, and it probably would be different in your own system anyway). 

If you need output as a number, simply wrap a TOINTEGER() around the whole thing.

It also accounts for leap years and effectively a rounding down solution by simply truncating numbers after the decimal place. Obviously, it's not accounting for service years above 2 digits, but if the company has someone working over 100 years, they have bigger problems than limitations on Story report calculations.

Another limitation is the leap year calculation might be off by a few hours for service in range of 1-3 years, but should be accurate to less than 18 hours differences or so. (You can divide by 365.2422 if you want more astronomically accurate calculations üòâ

Finally, only calculates to today's date, not As Of Date, but that's just a general story report limitation.

SAP, please add a ROUNDDOWN() function and an ASOFDATE() variable to Story reporting. Might as well add AGE() function too, like we had in Canvas reports to make all our lives easier.

entry.title: How to use the $SUM_PARTS function to get the weights of the components used in a configuration?
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

I have a configurable finished material, which has configurable materials as components and standard components assigned in the BOM. I want to calculate the total weight based on the components used. The components selected in the BOM depend on the configuration of FG01. As mentioned, some components are also configurable and the configuration and the weight is based on the configuration of FG01.

Thus something like this:

LevelMaterialRemarks
0FG01Finished material
1Configurable comp. 1Always included in BOM, weight depends on configuration of FG01
1.1Component 1.1 
1.2Components 1.2 
1Configurable comp. 2Selection depends on configuration, weight depends on configuration of FG01
1.1Component 2.1 
1.2Components 2.2 
1Standard component 1Always included in BOM, standard weight from material master
1Standard component 2Always included in BOM, standard weight from material master
1Standard component 3Always included in BOM, standard weight from material master
1Standard component 4Selection depends on configuration, standard weight from material master
1Standard component 5Selection depends on configuration, standard weight from material master

As I understand, I can use the $SUM_PARTS function in my dependency, with a syntax similar to this:

$SELF.WEIGHT = $SUM_PARTS ($PARENT, WEIGHT).

If I understand the documentation, I have to assign characteristics WEIGHT to all configurable components. 

"To add together the weights of the different components in a BOM, create characteristic WEIGHT and allocate it to all the configurable materials that you want to include in your calculation."

  • Should WEIGHT be a reference characteristic? If yes, to which table and field?
  • How to I retrieve the weight from the standard components that are not configurable and thus have no class assignment?

Moreover, I don't really understand this part.

"Create a configurable material as a placeholder and enter this material as the last item in the BOM. Assign characteristic WEIGHT is to the material. Allocate a procedure with the following source code to the BOM item: $SELF.WEIGHT = $SUM_PARTS ($PARENT, WEIGHT)"

  • How can I assure that this placeholder is not included in the production BOM?

Summarized, I have the following three questions:

  • Should WEIGHT be a reference characteristic? If yes, to which table and field?
  • How to I retrieve the weight from the standard components that are not configurable and thus have no class assignment?
  • How can I assure that the placeholder in the BOM is not included in the production BOM?

Kind regards,

 

Floyd

entry.title: Re: IDoc with Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh using the Event Add-On
entry.content:
Hi Sushant,

You can use ASAPIO Add-On for free with SAP Event Mesh, but not with SAP AEM. To use ASAPIO Add-On with SAP AEM comes with a tiered pricing. It is metered by the number of connections to AEM brokers. A connection is a broker enablement option that supports integration with one or multiple SAP on-premise ERP systems. Pricing is based solely on the number of enabled brokers, not on how many ERP systems are connected to each broker. Find the latest information and the calculator in the SAP Discovery Center.

entry.title: Re: BTP ABAP SaaS Solution: Custom Field not available in...
entry.content:
Hi Daniel,

thank you very much for the detailed explanation. This resolved the main issue for us.
Adding the C-view exposed via service definition and service binding to the relatedViewEntities was the missing piece. After re-activating the predefined field enabling, the fields became available in the services as expected.

One additional aspect we ran into afterwards that might be worth mentioning for others:

When activating the enabling, the framework generated a C-view extension (/TCON/C_EMPLOYEE_EXT) containing a virtual text element calculated via @ObjectModel.virtualElementCalculatedBy. In our ABAP Environment setup, this caused an ATC finding during transport release. To proceed, we had to adjust the ATC configuration (DEFAULT_GENERATED) so that the generated code could be released and deployed. After this adjustment, the software component could be deployed successfully and predefined custom fields could be used on consumer tenants.

From our perspective, it might be helpful if the documentation explicitly mentioned:

  • that the exposed C-view must be included in the predefined field enabling, not only the I-view, and
  • that activating predefined fields can generate virtual elements in the C-view which may require corresponding ATC configuration.

Just sharing this as additional context. Thanks again for the clarification and solution.

Best regards
Johannes

entry.title: Mapping Stock to New Nested Handling Units Using Migration Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Mapping Stock to New Nested Handling Units Using Migration Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

Step 1: Go to the ‚ÄòMigrate Your Data‚Äô tile and create a project by selecting the ‚ÄòHUM ‚Äì Handling Unit‚Äô object.

Img:1

Img:2

Img:3

Img:4

Step 2: Once the project is created, select the project and download the migration template.

 

Step 3: Fill in the required data in the tabs of the template. The detailed steps are provided below.

Tab 1: Bundles for Nested HUs

  • Maintain a Run ID when creating Nested HUs for a material.
  • The Run ID is used to group multiple Handling Units into a single Nested HU structure.

Example: If a carton containing material is packed together with other cartons onto a pallet, the cartons (inner HUs) and the pallet (outer HU) together form a Nested Handling Unit structure and must share the same Run ID (Bundle ID).

Tab 2: Header Data

  • Since an external number range is maintained in the backend configuration for HU packing types, the External HU ID is filled for the respective packing materials, Plant details.

Tab 3: Item Data

  • Maintain the material against the respective HU ID and enter the quantity to be migrated into the new Handling Units.

Scenario example used in this document:

  • At Pallet HU level, the Carton Box HU is assigned.
  • At Carton Box HU level, the Small Box HU is assigned.
  • At the Small Box HU level, the material ‚Äú42 ‚Äì SFG Material‚Äù is maintained with a quantity of 15 KG.

When this data is uploaded, the system:

  • Automatically assigns the stock to the respective HUs, and Creates the complete Nested HU structure, finally resulting in the Pallet HU containing all lower-level HUs.

Step 4: Upload File and Mapping Task

  • Upload the completed data template.

 

Step 5: Simulate

Step 6: Migrate

  • Finally, migration completed, the system creates the Handling Units (HUs) and assigns them to the existing stock for the material.

Check Stock: Display Stock Overview

  • The below screenshot confirms successful creation of Nested HUs, with stock correctly assigned from Small Box ‚Üí Carton Box ‚Üí Pallet HU.

  • Using Migration Cockpit, we successfully mapped existing stock into a nested HU structure, enabling accurate HU tracking and improved stock visibility in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

entry.title: My highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release
entry.content:
Welcome to 2026 and welcome to my SAP Cloud ERP 2602 product release highlights! This blog post guides you through the key improvements of the 2602 release of SAP Cloud ERP, focusing on how they support customers in running and evolving their core business processes. And it was again not easy to decide what to declare as highlights amongst the large number of innovations delivered. It's our 34th major release over the years, and I have collected an interesting range across functional, foundational and user experience capabilities. And of course, the AI journey continues to boost both well-known and new ERP processes to a new levels. We're all in on AI.

I wish the team would have granted me more space to talk you through all innovation shipped with the 2602 release , take this blog post as an appetizer for our team‚Äôs deep dive blogs per line of business. Prefer video over text? Take a look at my product update video, where my digital twin guides you through the key highlights. 

 

A new operating model for integrated business processes 

With the first release of 2026, we walk the talk of our SAP Business Suite and introduce a range of SAP-managed Integrated Business Processes, removing the complexity of integrating and monitoring multiple cloud solutions from our customer's and partner's activity list. We have carefully listened to your wishes and SAP delivers co-provisioning, functional and technical integration, including lifecycle management, allowing these activities to move in the background while customers focus on their core business. By shifting responsibility for aligned system provisioning, functional and technical integration, and lifecycle management from customers to SAP, we reduce complexity behind the scenes and enables a more seamless suite experience.

* Click here to access the links mentioned in the slide above

As an initial step, release 2602 delivers SAP-managed integration for two critical end-to-end processes as part of an Early Adopter Care (EAC) program. In Workforce Management, SAP provides SAP-managed provisioning and integration between SAP Cloud ERP and SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, supporting a streamlined Recruit-to-Retire process with consistent employee and financial data from day one. For Operational Procurement, integrated processes across SAP Cloud ERP, SAP Ariba Buying, and SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management simplify Procure-to-Pay activities and support a more unified procurement landscape.

These capabilities are enabled by blueprint-based provisioning, which changes how solution instances are deployed, integrated, and managed across the run phase. Instead of manual setup, customers can activate selective solutions or in the future complete suites that are provisioned and come already fully integrated together. Guided by a new suite experience in SAP for Me and based on SAP landscape modeling best practices, SAP applies a desired-state-based reconciliation to ensure transparency, consistency, and long-term stability across the application landscape.

AI innovations

SAP Joule for Consultants: Practical enhancements for your everyday project work

With this first release of year 2026, SAP Joule for Consultants continues to mature as a day-to-day companion for project focused workers, offering efficient access to trusted content, better transparency, and smoother workflows ‚Äì on demand. A new SAP Joule for Consultants console brings ‚ÄòWhat‚Äôs New‚Äô release notes, an integrated prompt library, and, where relevant, administrative insights such as usage metrics and system settings into one central entry point, helping teams stay aligned with current innovations.

 

 

Joule now also surfaces SAP Notes and SAP Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs) directly within conversations, based on existing customer entitlements. This allows consultants to reference validated SAP guidance without leaving their context, while administrators retain control through standard s-user assignments. Usability improvements further support efficient work: Quick links simplify navigation across Joule features, the conversation character limit has been increased to 10,000 characters to accommodate larger inputs such as code or detailed scenarios, and public SAP content sources have been refreshed and expanded.

Enhanced citation visibility improves transparency by clearly indicating the origin of information, including public web sources when applicable.

 

Finally, the initial ingestion of SAP Signavio Process Navigator reference content lays the groundwork for more architecture-aware guidance in future releases.

 

Finance

Accounting Accruals Agent (beta)

In the dynamic landscape of financial management, the introduction of the beta version of Accounting Accruals Agent marks a thoughtful stride towards empowering finance professionals with innovative tools tailored for efficiency. This intelligent agent draws from AI-driven capabilities to meticulously craft accrual proposals, transforming the traditionally labor-intensive process into a streamlined operation. By analyzing accounting policy documents, sifting through historical data, and executing precise calculations, this agent reduces the substantial time accountants typically spend during period-end accruals. The newfound simplicity in the ‚ÄòManage Accrual Proposals‚Äô app not only enhances the speed of reviewing and posting proposals but also offers detailed, AI-backed explanations for each calculated entry. This ensures that general ledger accountants gain not just time but also trust in AI‚Äôs role in augmenting their decision-making processes, thereby enabling a smoother and more efficient period-end close. This feature is going to be made generally available in SAP Cloud ERP 2602.

 

 

SAP User Experience

AI-assisted task automation (beta)

In everyday work, many tasks in SAP Cloud ERP follow the same patterns: Reviewing data, triggering follow-up steps, or keeping processes moving. With AI-assisted task automation, SAP introduces smart helpers that support users exactly in these moments. Built with generative AI and embedded directly in My Home, these helpers can take over routine steps within SAP applications while keeping users in control whenever decisions or data changes are required. Instead of replacing human judgement, the focus is on reducing manual effort and helping users progress through their tasks more smoothly. Over time, this creates a more natural way of working with automation, one that adapts to real user needs and daily workflows. Customers interested in shaping this capability early can join the beta program to explore the feature and provide feedback that will influence future AI-driven experiences in SAP Cloud ERP.

Check out this link to sign up for the beta testing and shape the future of AI innovations: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/4086 

 

 

Retail

Assortment module management 

Many non-retail industries integrate retail capabilities into their ERP systems to enhance customer services and collaboration, even in B2B. Most organizations today are expected to react faster to changing customer expectations while keeping operations efficient and scalable. This requires tools that simplify everyday work for planners and merchandisers, reduce operational friction, and make it easier to translate data and insights into action. In this context, intelligent assistance within core retail processes becomes increasingly important, especially where decisions around assortments directly influence customer experience and business outcomes.

In the area of Retail, Joule‚Äôs integration into assortment module management supports planners by making common tasks more accessible and less time-consuming. Instead of navigating multiple screens, users can rely on natural language interactions to create, update, or terminate assortments directly within the application. This reduces dependency on deep technical knowledge and helps teams complete routine tasks with greater confidence and efficiency. As a result, merchandising and category managers can spend less time on operational steps and more time focusing on assortment strategy and customer-centric planning.

For more information, please consult SAP Help Portal.

 

 

Asset Management

Maintenance notification creation and screening with Joule

In Asset Management, keeping maintenance processes running smoothly depends on timely and accurate notifications, often created under time pressure and by users outside of specialized maintenance roles. With Joule integrated into the maintenance notification process in SAP Cloud ERP, creating and screening notifications becomes more straightforward and accessible. Users can describe an issue in natural language and capture key details such as the technical object, priority, and description without navigating complex transaction flows. Moreover, users can access notifications in the ‚ÄòManage Maintenance Notification‚Äô SAP Fiori app (F5777), enabling quick acceptance and conversion into maintenance orders within a single conversational context. As a result, operators spend less time on documentation, while maintenance teams and managers benefit from clearer, more consistent information to plan and execute maintenance activities effectively.

 

SAP Activate innovations

SAP Activate introduces several innovations for the 2602 release, starting with a dedicated activation and implementation guidance for customers adopting SAP-managed integrations in the Early Adopter Care program, mentioned earlier.

Customers implementing SAP Cloud ERP will continue to benefit from easier access to implementation information with Joule, which is embedded in the ‚ÄôRoadmap Viewer‚Äô application on SAP for Me. Additionally, implementation teams can access up-to-date implementation guidance in nine languages: Chinese, English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, and Spanish. Change your language preferences in SAP for Me to view content in another language.

Customers conducting the upgrade to the 2602 release can leverage the lean upgrade roadmap in the ‚ÄòRoadmap Viewer‚Äô app or in SAP Cloud ALM to guide their team through the upgrade and post-upgrade activities. 

 

SAP Cloud ALM updates

In transformation projects, teams often invest a lot of time turning workshop outcomes, documents, and process discussions into structured requirements and test assets. With the latest updates in SAP Cloud ALM, this work becomes more streamlined across the project lifecycle. AI-assisted  requirements generation helps teams create initial requirements automatically based on Fit-to-Standard workshop transcripts, solution processes, and other project documentation, giving project members a solid starting point that can be reviewed and refined instead of built from scratch.

As project scopes evolve, requirements can now be moved easily between projects, supporting reuse and reducing duplication.

 

 Further enhancements focus on governance and test preparation.

New APIs for manual test cases, process hierarchies, and features make it easier to integrate SAP Cloud ALM into existing tool landscapes and automate project reporting or oversight. All SAP Cloud ALM APIs can be found on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

During test preparation, teams can now define where screenshots are required as test evidence, improving transparency and auditability during execution.

 

Updates to release assessment and scope dependency

Smarter upgrades in SAP Cloud ERP require a clear understanding of customer¬¥s individually relevant applications and scope items. The release assessment and scope dependency (RASD) tool continues to evolve, incorporating customer feedback to make impact analysis more transparent and easier to work with. Recent updates simplify how assessment results are shared, allowing users to download content across all tiles, or selected ones, into a single ZIP file with structured Excel outputs that can be reviewed, filtered, and discussed across distributed project teams.

Beyond usability improvements, RASD now provides more precise guidance for upgrade decisions. The introduction of a successor view helps identify recommended follow-on apps, supporting smoother transition planning.

In addition, enhanced views in the personalized 'What‚Äôs New Viewer' clearly differentiate between activated, used, and impacted scope items, helping teams focus on what truly matters in their system.

Together, these enhancements support more informed discussions, reduce uncertainty during release preparation, and help teams approach upgrades with greater clarity and confidence.

 

Other innovations across various LoBs

Supply Chain Management ‚Äì Warehouse management

Interface to warehouse automation systems for efficiently processing warehouse orders

In the evolving landscape of warehouse management, the integration of warehouse automation systems is set to significantly enhance operational efficiency. By seamlessly distributing warehouse orders to automated subsystems, businesses can ensure smooth and coordinated task execution. This interface not only sends out orders but also receives confirmations of warehouse tasks, creating a continuous feedback loop that ensures transparency and efficiency. Such integration significantly cuts down manual intervention, allowing for a more streamlined process that minimizes errors and enhances productivity. The main advantage lies in the ability to process warehouse orders more efficiently, capitalizing on automation to handle tasks that were once labor-intensive. This means warehouse operations can maintain a high level of accuracy while handling greater volumes, ultimately enhancing the overall supply chain performance and reliability.

 

 

 

Manufacturing

Production order combination enablement

In the Manufacturing line of business, we are happy to introduce production order combination enablement, which offers a practical solution to streamline operations and enhance efficiency. By merging identical operations from different production orders into a single consolidated order, manufacturers can optimize their processes right from the ‚ÄòManage Production Orders‚Äô app. This functionality allows for the creation, maintenance, and confirmation of combined orders, which in turn supports effective cost distribution and settlement through new event-based costing. By reducing setup times and overhead charges, this approach not only increases production throughput but also achieves considerable cost savings. This feature empowers manufacturers to focus their efforts on boosting output while maintaining a keen eye on cost efficiency, creating a more agile and responsive production environment.

 

Professional Services

Intercompany cost allocations reconciliation review booklet

In the Professional Services domain, the enhancement of the ‚ÄòIntercompany Review Booklet‚Äô app offers a significant boost in transparency and traceability for intercompany cost allocations. By displaying the complete end-to-end document flow, this app helps reconcile management accounting postings with billing and accounts receivable documents. This comprehensive view is invaluable during closing procedures, as it allows businesses to ensure their data's completeness by clearly identifying services and expenses that have been billed, are partially billed, or remain unbilled. Furthermore, the app provides audit-relevant information on billed intercompany services, offering businesses the assurance and documentation needed for clear internal and external audits. This capability aids organizations in maintaining robust financial processes while enhancing their ability to track and manage intercompany transactions efficiently. Starting with release 2602, the report will include an enhanced breakdown of billed entries, tracing them all the way to the receiver FI journal entry/affiliated expenses.  

 

Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Enhanced integration of project plan information with SAP Cloud ERP

In the domain of Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management, enhancing the integration of project plan information with SAP Cloud ERP was one of the items discussed and designed in our customer product councils. This innovation facilitates seamless synchronization of project plan data between SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Project and Resource Management, enabling a more cohesive project management experience. Users can manually trigger updates to project dates in SAP Cloud ERP, ensuring that information remains current and accurate. Furthermore, the automated bi-directional synchronization of project plan data significantly reduces the manual effort involved in data maintenance, allowing teams to focus on strategic initiatives. With greater scope control and improved integration, organizations can enjoy comprehensive visibility of critical information across different solutions, thus enhancing data quality and operational efficiency. This development empowers project managers with the tools needed to effectively monitor and control project progress, fostering better decision-making and resource allocation throughout the project lifecycle.

 

Summary

I hope this overview of the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release highlights has provided helpful insights into the latest updates and enhancements as well as excitement for the upgrade. As SAP Cloud ERP continues to evolve, these innovations aim to support more efficient processes, clearer guidance, and a smoother experience across implementations and upgrades.

Let me know which innovation stands out most to you and what your personal highlights from this release are: Feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

In the coming weeks, we‚Äôll take a closer look at additional business- and industry-specific innovations in follow-up blogs. Be sure to visit our community page to connect with SAP experts, ask questions, and exchange feedback. To stay up to date with future content, follow the PSCC_Enablement tag and keep an eye out for upcoming posts.

Feel free to follow me at BeSchulze in the community and on LinkedIn to not miss any updates. 

Let‚Äôs keep advancing together‚Äîtowards a smarter, more connected cloud ERP future.

Yours,

Bert
